newInstance().Description: Get a new XPathFactory instance using the default object model, @B_javax#xml#xpath#XPathFactory#DEFAULT_OBJECT_MODEL_URI_E@, the W3C DOM. This method is functionally equivalent to: Since the implementation for the W3C DOM is always available, this method will never fail.

Parameters: String: Identifies the underlying object model. The specification only defines the URI @B_javax#xml#xpath#XPathFactory#DEFAULT_OBJECT_MODEL_URI_E@, http://java.sun.com/jaxp/xpath/dom for the W3C DOM, the org.w3c.dom package, and implementations are free to introduce other URIs for other object models.
Throws: If the specified object model is unavailable.
newInstance(java.lang.String).Description: Get a new XPathFactory instance using the specified object model. To find a XPathFactory object, this method looks the following places in the following order where "the class loader" refers to the context class loader: If everything fails, an XPathFactoryConfigurationException will be thrown. Tip for Trouble-shooting: See @B_java#util#Properties#load_E@ for exactly how a property file is parsed. In particular, colons ':' need to be escaped in a property file, so make sure the URIs are properly escaped in it. For example:
newInstance(java.lang.String).FullName: public static final XPathFactory newInstance (String uri)

newXPath().Description: Return a new XPath using the underlying object model determined when the XPathFactory was instantiated.

Throws: if this XPathFactory or the XPaths it creates cannot support this feature.
getFeature(java.lang.String).Description: Get the state of the named feature. Feature names are fully qualified @B_java#net#URI_E@s. Implementations may define their own features. An @B_javax#xml#xpath#XPathFactoryConfigurationException_E@ is thrown if this XPathFactory or the XPaths it creates cannot support the feature. It is possible for an XPathFactory to expose a feature value but be unable to change its state.

XPathFactory().Description: Protected constructor as @B_javax#xml#xpath#XPathFactory#newInstance_E@, @B_javax#xml#xpath#XPathFactory#newInstance_E@ or @B_javax#xml#xpath#XPathFactory#newInstance_E@ should be used to create a new instance of an XPathFactory.

Throws: If the specified object model is unavailable.
newInstance(java.lang.String,java.lang.S.FullName: public static XPathFactory newInstance (String uri, String factoryClassName, ClassLoader classLoader)

Returns: true if XPathFactory supports objectModel, else false.
Parameters: String: Specifies the object model which the returned XPathFactory will understand.
isObjectModelSupported(java.lang.String).Description: Is specified object model supported by this XPathFactory?

Parameters: boolean: Is feature state true or false.
Throws: if this XPathFactory or the XPaths it creates cannot support this feature.
setFeature(java.lang.String, boolean).Description: Set a feature for this XPathFactory and XPaths created by this factory. Feature names are fully qualified @B_java#net#URI_E@s. Implementations may define their own features. An @B_javax#xml#xpath#XPathFactoryConfigurationException_E@ is thrown if this XPathFactory or the XPaths it creates cannot support the feature. It is possible for an XPathFactory to expose a feature value but be unable to change its state. All implementations are required to support the @B_javax#xml#XMLConstants#FEATURE_SECURE_PROCESSING_E@ feature. When the feature is true, any reference to an external function is an error. Under these conditions, the implementation must not call the @B_javax#xml#xpath#XPathFunctionResolver_E@ and must throw an @B_javax#xml#xpath#XPathFunctionException_E@.
setFeature(java.lang.String, boolean).FullName: public abstract void setFeature (String name, boolean value)

setXPathVariableResolver(javax.xml.xpath.Description: Establish a default variable resolver. Any XPath objects constructed from this factory will use the specified resolver by default. A NullPointerException is thrown if resolver is null.

Parameters: boolean: Is feature state true or false.
Throws: if this XPathFactory or the XPaths it creates cannot support this feature.

Implementations may define their own features. An @B_javax#xml#xpath#XPathFactoryConfigurationException_E@ is thrown if this XPathFactory or the XPaths it creates cannot support the feature. It is possible for an XPathFactory to expose a feature value but be unable to change its state. All implementations are required to support the @B_javax#xml#XMLConstants#FEATURE_SECURE_PROCESSING_E@ feature. When the feature is true, any reference to an external function is an error. Under these conditions, the implementation must not call the @B_javax#xml#xpath#XPathFunctionResolver_E@ and must throw an @B_javax#xml#xpath#XPathFunctionException_E@.
setFeature(java.lang.String,boolean).FullName: public abstract void setFeature (String name, boolean value)

setXPathFunctionResolver(javax.xml.xpath.Description: Establish a default function resolver. Any XPath objects constructed from this factory will use the specified resolver by default. A NullPointerException is thrown if resolver is null.

ClassDesc: An XPathFactory instance can be used to create @B_javax#xml#xpath#XPath_E@ objects. See @B_javax#xml#xpath#XPathFactory#newInstance_E@ for lookup mechanism.
